story.text: LOS ANGELES Drive-in restaurant chain Sonic Corp. (SONC.O) on Wednesday reported lower quarterly earnings due to higher interest expense and costs for paying down debt. Net income for the fiscal first quarter was $15.3 million, or 19 cents per share, compared with $16.4 million, or 18 cents per share, in the year-ago period. Wall Street analysts, on average, had been expecting earnings of 19 cents per share, according to Reuters Estimates. In November, Sonic said first-quarter earnings would be at the low end of its 19 cents to 20 cents per share estimate because of weaker-than-expected sales at franchised restaurants.
story.title: sonic 1st - quarter net earnings fall
